title.narrative: Emergency support for the immediate restoration of food production in the municipalities most affected by Hurricane Irma

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to rehabilitate local food production capacity and livelihood in the communities of the most affected municipalities by Hurricane Irma in Cuba. FAO will use CERF funds to restore agricultural production through provision of 19,300 M2 galvanized zinc roof tiles and rehabilitate five greenhouse tunnels. 163,073 beneficiaries will benefit directly from this project, which will be implemented within six months.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency support for the immediate restoration of food production in the municipalities most affected by Hurricane Irma

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS CUBA RAPID RESPONSE STORM 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
